Add New Address

Our mission at DMACC is to provide quality, affordable student-centered education and training. Our goal is to empower students of all ages and backgrounds to pursue lifes opportunities and achieve their career dreams.

DMACC is a nationally accredited college, with multiple campuses in central Iowa: Ames, Ankeny, Boone, Carroll, Knoxville, Newton, Perry, Des Moines, and West Des Moines. We also offer a wide range of online classes, including online degree and certificate programs.

More info

pages.pageprocessor: function pageprocessorAboutPage2(pagedef, $scope, $routeParams, $compile, $http, $rootScope, $sce, $window, $location) {var data1 = $compile($(pagedef.datatemplate))($scope);$("#appContent").append(data1);}
pages.datatemplate: Sample Data

There is no fee to apply for admission to DMACC. Our college operates under a continuous admissions process, so acceptance is granted when admission procedures and requirements have been completed.
Note: if you have submitted an admission application in the past three years, you do not need to reapply. Contact the DMACC Admissions Department about your status.

Start Application
Information for Current Students
Returning to DMACC
Guest Students
Schedule a Visit

Des Moines Area Community College 515-964-6200 800-362-2127
Ask a Question
Campus Locations
Admissions
Financial Aid
Phone Directory

What better way to find out if DMACC is a good fit for you. We invite you to visit one of our campuses or learning centers by scheduling a campus tour, attending a Discover DMACC Day, or by taking an online virtual tour.
Schedule a visit
Campuses
Maps
Virtual Tours

DMACC offers 153 programs and short-term certificates. Many of these are in STEM-related career and technical fields. You can earn a one-year diploma or a two-year Associate degree. DMACC also offers many professional transfer programs that lead to four-year and advanced degrees.

More info

DMACCs Continuing Education department is committed to lifelong learning, offering non-credit classes dedicated to personal and professional development. Whether youre looking for something to help you update your skills, advance in your current job, or just learning for the fun of it, check our schedule often we are always adding something new.
Course Search
Contact Us
Registration Information
Campus Locations
Emergency Closing Info

Transfer Information

At DMACC, you can tailor your academic experience to suit your career goals and seamlessly transfer to a four-year university. DMACCs transfer initiative encompasses 42 liberal arts and science career tracks and 17 professional transfer programs, such as law and medicine.

More info

Financial aid at DMACC is need-based. Students may apply for financial aid at DMACC by filing a FAFSA using DMACCs School Code: 004589. DMACC also offers scholarships, grants and a work study program.

DMACC and area high schools have formed a partnership to offer high school students opportunities to earn college credit while still in high school. Juniors and seniors are able to enroll and complete DMACC courses at their home high school, at DMACC, or online.
